title: CANAL / SAMARAN BUTTER SIGN VISCAL
description: You find tire tracks indicating that a car leapt over the canal.

dialogueTree.title: Perception (Sight): "The crumpled SAMARAN BUTTER billboa..."
dialogueTree.text: The crumpled SAMARAN BUTTER billboard still soaks in the canal, marked by tyre tracks.

links.title: You: "Look at the crater."
links.text: Look at the crater.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Side slip marks indicate that the v..."
links.text: Side slip marks indicate that the vehicle was travelling up the crater at 35 km/h.

links.title: You: "Look at the roof of the shack."
links.text: Look at the roof of the shack.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The black marks on the roof indicat..."
links.text: The black marks on the roof indicate that the vehicle *vaulted* from the crater to the roof of the shack.

links.title: You: "Look at the sloping metal roof pane..."
links.text: Look at the sloping metal roof panel.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The panel served as a take-off ramp..."
links.text: The panel served as a take-off ramp.

links.title: You: "Look at the broken posts."
links.text: Look at the broken posts.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The vehicle soared through the air,..."
links.text: The vehicle soared through the air, hitting the billboard and upsetting the posts. Then it continued its flight, taking the billboard with it.

links.title: You: "Look at the sign."
links.text: Look at the sign.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The sign broke the vehicle's fall i..."
links.text: The sign broke the vehicle's fall into the canal.

links.title: Conceptualization: "The SAMARAN BUTTER billboard still..."
links.text: The SAMARAN BUTTER billboard still looks freshly painted, suggesting it took the plunge recently.

links.title: You: "How recently?"
links.text: How recently?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Within the past 72 hours."
links.text: Within the past 72 hours.

links.title: You: "Look at the opposite bank."
links.text: Look at the opposite bank.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Still speeding, the vehicle made a..."
links.text: Still speeding, the vehicle made a loop and vanished into the fog along the coast.

links.title: You: "What was the model of this phantom..."
links.text: What was the model of this phantom vehicle?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There are two good candidates: the..."
links.text: There are two good candidates: the Coupris 40 and the Linnea G22.

links.title: You: "Why the Coupris 40?"
links.text: Why the Coupris 40?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's about the right size, and the..."
links.text: It's about the right size, and the tyre marks look like they came from the skinny tyres frequently found on that motor carriage.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Coupris 40 is a very popular mo..."
links.text: The Coupris 40 is a very popular model with bank clerks, topping-pie delivery drivers, secondary school teachers, cops, strippers dressed as cops, undressed strippers...

links.title: You: "Why the Linnea G22?"
links.text: Why the Linnea G22?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Very sturdy but light motor carriag..."
links.text: Very sturdy but light motor carriage. More likely than most to survive that jump.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Linnea G22 is not a particularl..."
links.text: The Linnea G22 is not a particularly popular model due to its peculiar proportions, which the manufacturer's design team probably thought about for too long.

links.title: You: "What now?"
links.text: What now?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Now? You'd have to follow the track..."
links.text: Now? You'd have to follow the tracks to be sure.

links.title: You: ""Yup -- *I* did this.""
links.text: "Yup -- *I* did this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Clearly, yes. Dwelling on it longe..."
links.text: "Clearly, yes. Dwelling on it longer only makes it worse."

links.title: You: ""Yup -- *I* did this.""
links.text: "Yup -- *I* did this."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Clearly. The motor carriage in ques..."
links.text: Clearly. The motor carriage in question was a Coupris 40 -- mere minutes before it took a final voyage into the ocean.

links.title: You: "Blink. [Leave.]"
links.text: Blink. [Leave.]

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks on, waiting fo..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks on, waiting for you to wrap up your analysis.

dialogueTree.title: Perception (Sight): "A crumpled billboard reading "SAMAR..."
dialogueTree.text: A crumpled billboard reading "SAMARAN BUTTER" soaks in the canal. Two ugly lines mar the bright countenance of the blond boy depicted.

links.title: Interfacing: "The sign billboard has fallen on th..."
links.text: The sign billboard has fallen on the water lock, keeping it open -- and thus out of order.

links.title: You: "What is Samaran Butter?"
links.text: What is Samaran Butter?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Whatever it is, the boy on the bill..."
links.text: Whatever it is, the boy on the billboard seems very happy about it.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Goat milk butter. The Samaran terra..."
links.text: Goat milk butter. The Samaran terrain makes it easier to raise goats than cows, and the local goat farmers produce high-quality meat and dairy staples that add variety to other nations' diets.

links.title: Perception (Taste): "It's an acquired taste."
links.text: It's an acquired taste.

links.title: You: "Attempt to reconstruct what happene..."
links.text: Attempt to reconstruct what happened here.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Judging by the size of the impact a..."
links.text: Judging by the size of the impact and the parallel lines of burnt rubber, the cause was probably a motor vehicle.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "These match the tyre tracks you saw..."
links.text: These match the tyre tracks you saw earlier -- *your* tyre tracks.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "These look like the same tyre track..."
links.text: These look like the same tyre tracks I saw earlier -- in front of the Whirling-in-Rags.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Just some tasteless advertising at..."
links.text: Just some tasteless advertising at the bottom of a canal. No use rubbernecking now.

links.title: You: "Nothing more to see here. [Leave.]"
links.text: Nothing more to see here. [Leave.]
